bug.summary: [tune][docs] Search Algorithm Example w/ HyperOpt isn't better than random search
bug.description: The example at <denchmark-link:https://ray.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tune-tutorial.html#search-algorithms-in-tune>https://ray.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tune-tutorial.html#search-algorithms-in-tune</denchmark-link> for using HyperOpt is not better than random search, according to my understanding. The default n_inital_points for the HyperOpt searcher is 20, which I think means the first 20 trials are drawn randomly. Since the example in the docs uses num_samples=10, this isn't really illustrating search with HyperOpt -- or am I missing somethig?

comments.comment: Ah yeah the doc was written to illustrate usage, but I didn't carefully check all the parameters. Do you want to push a fix? happy to merge.
